title: Successful Welsh Wine Estate Asks £15 Million
text:
A sprawling wine estate in Wales spread across two sites that comes complete with a successful wine business, a country house and a total of 137 acres hit the market in September with a £15 million (US$18.4 million) asking price.

Perfect for any oenophile looking to dive head first into a wine business, the two sites—Ancre Hill and Newton Court Farm—close to the town of Monmouth, are planted with 30,000 vines comprising 90% Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, with Albarino making up the bulk of the remainder.
